FuncDef:
The warning-exhaust command enables the address exhaustion alarm function for an IPv6 address pool.
The undo warning-exhaust command disables the address exhaustion alarm function for an IPv6 address pool.
By default, the address exhaustion alarm function is disabled for an IPv6 address pool.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the warning-exhaust command is executed, the system generates an address exhaustion alarm when addresses in an IPv6 address pool are exhausted, prompting the administrator to plan the IPv6 addresses. When IPv6 addresses in the IPv6 address pool are exhausted, users cannot go online.
When address usage of the IPv6 address pool falls below 90%, the address exhaustion alarm is cleared.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
